G.T.4336
FOOD PRODUCTION SCHEMES, IRELAND.
Memorandum prepared in compliance with Chief Secretary's Minute of 17th March, 1917.
Week ended 24th April, 1918.
The following is a brief statement on the work of the Department during the past week in furtherance of increased Food Production in Ireland:-
TILLAGE DEFAULTERS.
The inspection of holdings is being continued on the usual lines.
The season for ploughing is now drawing to a close, and it is therefore becoming impossible to make lettings of land in conacre. Accordingly, the number of cases in which the Department have effected entry during the past week has been much reduced.
LOANS FOR AGRICULTURAL IMPLEMENTS.
Forty-two applications for loans fer agricultural implements were received by the Department during the past week. The total value of machinery ordered from the beginning of the present year to date, under the Scheme, amounts to Â£27,855.
PROGRESS OF TILLAGE OPERATIONS.
Sowing of grain crops rapidly noaring completion, except on large farms where additional land is being brought under cultivation in compliance with the Tillage Orders. The planting of potatoes and sowing of flax are also proceeding. Winter wheat and oarly sown oats are reported to be very promising in general.
